content.question:
​

<math alttext="x"><semantics><mi>x</mi><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>
<math alttext="0"><semantics><mn>0</mn><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>
<math alttext="2"><semantics><mn>2</mn><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>
<math alttext="4"><semantics><mn>4</mn><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>
<math alttext="6"><semantics><mn>6</mn><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>
<math alttext="f open parentheses x close parentheses"><semantics><mrow><mi>f</mi><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>
<math alttext="3"><semantics><mn>3</mn><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>
<math alttext="48"><semantics><mn>48</mn><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>
<math alttext="768"><semantics><mn>768</mn><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>
<math alttext="12 , 288"><semantics><mn>12,288</mn><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>
​
​The table gives values of the function <math alttext="f"><semantics><mi>f</mi><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> for selected values of <math alttext="x"><semantics><mi>x</mi><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>. Which of the following expressions could define <math alttext="f open parentheses x close parentheses"><semantics><mrow><mi>f</mi><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> ?

choices.label: ​<math alttext="2 plus 4 to the power of x"><semantics><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>+</mo><msup><mn>4</mn><mi>x</mi></msup></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>

​<math alttext="3 times 4 to the power of x"><semantics><mrow><mn>3</mn><mo>·</mo><msup><mn>4</mn><mi>x</mi></msup></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>

​<math alttext="3 times 16 to the power of x"><semantics><mrow><mn>3</mn><mo>·</mo><msup><mn>16</mn><mi>x</mi></msup></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>

​<math alttext="4 times 3 to the power of x"><semantics><mrow><mn>4</mn><mo>·</mo><msup><mn>3</mn><mi>x</mi></msup></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>

content.answer: ​<math alttext="3 times 4 to the power of x"><semantics><mrow><mn>3</mn><mo>·</mo><msup><mn>4</mn><mi>x</mi></msup></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>

topic.text: 2.5: Exponential Function Context and Data Modeling

skill.text: Skill 1.C: Construct new functions, using transformations, compositions, inverses, or regressions, that may be useful in modeling contexts, criteria, or data, with and without technology.
